title: The San Andreas Fault
description: A quick, practical guide to The San Andreas Fault.

hook.text: A 1,200-km crack runs through California. Two plates are sliding past each other.

buildup.text: The Pacific Plate moves northwest. The North American Plate moves southeast.

discovery.text: This is a transform fault â€” plates slide sideways, not over or under each other.

twist.text: Los Angeles and San Francisco are on different plates, slowly getting closer.

climax.text: In about 15 million years, LA will sit next to San Francisco.

punchline.text: California is slowly tearing itself apart â€” one earthquake at a time.
